From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: intéressante

Danish

[edit]

Adjective

[edit]

interessante

  1. definite singular of interessant
  2. plural of interessant

Dutch

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˌɪn.tə.rɛˈsɑn.tə/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Hyphenation: in‧te‧res‧san‧te

Adjective

[edit]

interessante

  1. inflection of interessant:
    1. masculine/feminine singular attributive
    2. definite neuter singular attributive
    3. plural attributive

German

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Adjective

[edit]

interessante

  1. inflection of interessant:
    1. strong/mixed nominative/accusative feminine singular
    2. strong nominative/accusative plural
    3. weak nominative all-gender singular
    4. weak accusative feminine/neuter singular

Interlingua

[edit]

Adjective

[edit]

interessante

  1. interesting

Italian

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /in.te.resˈsan.te/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Rhymes: -ante
  • Hyphenation: in‧te‧res‧sàn‧te

Adjective

[edit]

interessante m or f by sense (plural interessanti, superlative interessantissimo)

  1. interesting

Derived terms

[edit]
  • in stato interessante

Participle

[edit]

interessante m or f by sense (plural interessanti)

  1. present participle of interessare

Anagrams

[edit]
  • annesteresti, innastereste, reinnestaste

Norwegian Bokmål

[edit]

Adjective

[edit]

interessante

  1. definite singular of interessant
  2. plural of interessant

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Spanish interesante. By surface analysis, interessar (“to interest”) +‎ -ante.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.te.ɾeˈsɐ̃.t͡ʃi/
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.te.ɾeˈsɐ̃.t͡ʃi/
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.te.ɾeˈsɐ̃.te/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ĩ.tɨ.ɾɨˈsɐ̃.tɨ/, (with elision) /ĩ.tɾɨˈsɐ̃.tɨ/, /ẽ.tɨ.ɾɨˈsɐ̃.tɨ/, (with elision) /ẽ.tɾɨˈsɐ̃.tɨ/

  • Audio (Portugal (Porto)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -ɐ̃tɨ, -ɐ̃tʃi
  • Hyphenation: in‧te‧res‧san‧te

Adjective

[edit]

interessante m or f (plural interessantes, comparable, comparative mais interessante, superlative o mais interessante or interessantíssimo)

  1. interesting (arousing or holding someone’s interest)
    Antonym: desinteressante
    1. entertaining; amusing
      Esse filme não é lá muito interessante.
      This film is not that interesting.
      Synonyms: (Portugal, colloquial) fixe, (Brazil, colloquial) legal
      Antonyms: chato, sem graça, enfadonho
    2. worthy of consideration; in one’s interest
      É uma oferta interessante, mas eu estou sem dinheiro.
      It is an interesting offer, but I’m out of money.
    3. unique, strange or unexpected; curious
      Ouvi um boato interessante sobre o senhor.
      I’ve heard a curious rumour about you.
      Synonym: curioso

Quotations

[edit]
  • For quotations using this term, see Citations:interessante.

Noun

[edit]

interessante m (uncountable)

  1. the interesting aspects of something
    O interessante desse jogo é que você pode usar asas para voar.
    The interesting thing about this game is that you can use wings to fly.
